result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillip Lloyd Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: * Restitution payable JOINT AND SEVERAL (with Defendant LEE EDWARD BENNETT JR on 15CF759) to EDDIE L for ONE THOUSAND NINE HUNDRED DOLLARS ($1,900.00) or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. 

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount deemed reasonable from wages and from other monies held in in the defendants inmate account under Sec. 973.02(11)(c) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor under 18 USC Section 922(g)(9).  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.

* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. 
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with 14CF4426 AND COUNT 1. Credit for ONE HUNDRED EIGHTEEN (118) DAYS time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Phillip Lloyd Lee

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (22 pages) commencing MARCH 29, 2017 received and filed.
Per request of court reporter.
EDDIE L.  Filed, sdg.

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of THREE (3) YEARS, with credit for ONE HUNDRED EIGHTEEN (118) DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is ONE (1) YEAR;  the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is TWO (2) YEARS.  The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  CONCURRENT TO 14CF4426 AND COUNT 2.

AS TO COUNT 2:

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of THREE (3) YEARS, with credit for ONE HUNDRED EIGHTEEN (118) DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is ONE (1) YEAR;  the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is TWO (2) YEARS.  The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  CONCURRENT TO 14CF4426 AND COUNT 1.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. 
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.
* Restitution payable JOINT AND SEVERAL (with Defendant LEE EDWARD BENNETT JR on 15CF759) to EDDIE L for ONE THOUSAND NINE HUNDRED DOLLARS ($1,900.00) or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor under 18 USC Section 922(g)(9).  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount deemed reasonable from wages and from other monies held in in the defendants inmate account under Sec. 973.02(11)(c) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Phillip Lloyd Lee in court with attorney Meighan Martha Anger.  Defendant Phillip Lloyd Lee in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in br. 33.
Defendant to the Court.  Filed, sdg.
Matter set for Returrn on Warrant before Br. 33.  Return on Warrant scheduled for 03-29-2017 at 02:30 pm.  sdg

Matter was staffed.  Defendant failing to comply with the DPA, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Defendant Phillip Lloyd Lee in court with attorney Debra J Patterson for Caitlin Hazard Firer.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

DTC - PHASE III

Review Hearing proceeds.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  Court finds that the defendant is not in compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract.  No sanctions are imposed.  THREE (3) points were awarded.  Sobriety date to be reset.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Per email from case manager.  Case is adjourned from 03-11-2016 to 03-04-2016 at 2:30pm.  sdg

Defendant Phillip Lloyd Lee in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Phillip Lloyd Lee in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Case transferred to br 6 for drug treatment court admissions on 6/10/2015 at 1:30pm.  lms

Attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood in court, defendant Phillip Lloyd Lee not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another date; defendant may be eligible for drug treatment court. DA's Office still reviewing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood in court, defendant Phillip Lloyd Lee not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Parties waiting to hear from drug treatment court to determne eligibility.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Discharge Summary from Justice Point, received and filed.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Same bail.

Attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood in court, defendant Phillip Lloyd Lee not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived his client's appearance and requested a scheduling date.  So ordered by the Court.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING (17 pages) commencing FEBRUARY 27, 2015 received and filed.kl

Defendant Phillip Lloyd Lee in court with attorney Steve Sargent for Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Phillip Lloyd Lee in custody.  Ron Dague for Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Upon oral motion by the State, Court amends the criminal complaint to reflect the correction of the address of "4700 North Hopkins Street."  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #14CF4426 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:John Kohler-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case has been reassigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20 due to lower pending case.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with 4702 N Hopkins Street or Co-Defendant Lee Bennett

Defendant Phillip Lloyd Lee in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Phillip Lloyd Lee in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised due to lower pending case this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
